title: Montana becomes first state to ban TikTok
description: Montana Gov. Greg Gianforte has signed the country's first law restricting downloads of TikTok. The platform has responded in a statement saying the ban "infringes on the First Amendment rights of the people of Montana." NBC's Danny Cevallos reports.

title: Montana becomes first state to ban TikTok after governor signs bill into law
description: Montana officially became the first state to ban TikTok on Wednesday after Gov. Greg Gainforte signs bill into law.

title: Secret Service director 'livid' over apparent security lapse at national security adviser's home
description: The incident, which occured in the middle of the night a few weeks ago, is largely being considered a “human failure” within the agency, sources said.

title: Some Senate Democrats urge Biden to prepare to invoke the 14th Amendment to tackle the debt limit
description: Some Senate Democrats are circulating a letter urging President Joe Biden to prepare to invoke the 14th Amendment to lift the debt ceiling.

title: Penguin Random House and Florida parents sue school district over book bans
description: Penguin Random House, authors, parents and a free speech group filed a lawsuit Wednesday against a Florida school district for removing 10 books related to race and the LGBTQ community after a high school teacher complained.

title: DeSantis signs 'Don't Say Gay' expansion, gender-affirming care ban
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signed four bills restricting LGBTQ rights, including an expansion of the “Don’t Say Gay” law and a ban on transition-related care.

title: Biden says he is 'confident' on reaching debt ceiling deal with Republicans
description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he is confident leaders could reach a deal on the budget and debt ceiling.

title: Idaho college student slayings suspect Bryan Kohberger indicted by grand jury
description: An Idaho grand jury has indicted the man suspected in the slayings of four college students on murder charges, paving the way for an arraignment and expected trial.

title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to Illinois assault weapons ban
description: The Supreme Court decided on a new Illinois law that bans assault-style weapons like the AR-15 semiautomatic rifle, used in multiple mass shootings.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan involved in 'near catastrophic car chase' with paparazzi in N.Y.
description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, were involved in a “near catastrophic" car chase with paparazzi in the United States, a spokesperson said Wednesday.

title: DOJ charges former Apple engineer with theft of autonomous car tech for China
description: A former Apple software engineer was charged with stealing Apple’s autonomous technology for a Chinese self-driving car company, the Department of Justice announced Tuesday.

title: Mother accused of kidnapping Illinois girl from 'Unsolved Mysteries' is released on bond
description: An Illinois girl whose disappearance was featured on Netflix's "Unsolved Mysteries" was found alive in North Carolina last week, six years after she was allegedly abducted by her mother.

title: Pentagon's top policymaker Kahl plans to resign, officials say
description: The Pentagon’s top policymaker plans to resign, officials say. Colin Kahl, under secretary of defense for policy since April 2021, will likely leave this summer.

title: In nod to urgency, aides for Biden and McCarthy hold late-night debt ceiling talks
description: White House negotiators met Speaker Kevin McCarthy' aides at the Capitol to try to hammer out a deal to raise the debt ceiling ahead of a potential default.

title: See first ever full-size digital scan of the Titanic
description: The first full-size digital scan of the Titanic as it sits on the bottom of the Atlantic has been released — and it’s revealing amazing details of the ship that sank 111 years ago.

title: Twitter CEO Elon Musk addresses conspiracy theories in CNBC interview
description: CNBC anchor David Faber sat down with Tesla and Twitter CEO Elon Musk in a wide-ranging interview that included Musk’s views on politics, online conspiracy theories and working from home.

title: Kari Lake's last challenge to loss in Arizona governor's race goes to trial
description: Trial begins over the final legal claim in Republican Kari Lake’s challenge of her defeat six months ago to Democrat Katie Hobbs in the Arizona governor’s race.

title: Inside ChatGPT: How AI chatbots work
description: As companies scramble to figure out how to adapt in the age of ChatGPT, here’s what you should know about how AI chatbots work.

title: CEO behind ChatGPT urges Congress to crack down on AI
description: Sam Altman, who helped create ChatGPT, testified before Congress and urged lawmakers to pass laws regulating artificial intelligence as fast as possible, warning that the technology could “cause significant harm to the world.” NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY, and Jake Ward weighs in with analysis.

title: Appeals court to hold hearing on future availability of abortion pill mifepristone
description: A federal appeals court in Louisiana is scheduled to hear arguments Wednesday in a case that could help determine the availability of mifepristone.

title: 2023’s biggest election: A resilient Dem governor vs. an ascendant Kentucky GOP
description: After winning the GOP primary, Kentucky Republican Daniel Cameron faces a resilient red-state Democrat, Gov. Andy Beshear, in the general election.

title: Ron DeSantis expands his circle as he prepares to run for president
description: As Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis moves to launch his 2024 campaign, he is "beginning to take advice from people who know what they’re doing," said one source.

title: Florida Democrats flip the Jacksonville mayor’s office in a major upset
description: Democrat Donna Deegan won the Jacksonville mayoral race Tuesday night, a shocking upset that hands Florida Democrats a major shot of energy.

title: Kentucky GOP Secretary of State Michael Adams fends off challengers touting election fraud
description: Kentucky Secretary of State Michael Adams won the GOP primary Tuesday, fending off challenges from two candidates who campaigned on voter fraud claims.
